items.headline: Harden Shines in Cavs Debut, Jokic Makes History, Murray Injured
items.summary: James Harden dropped 23 points in his Cleveland Cavaliers debut, leading them to a 132-126 victory over the Sacramento Kings. Meanwhile, Nikola Jokic soared past Oscar Robertson for second all-time in triple-doubles with his 182nd career effort. However, the Denver Nuggets also saw star guard Jamal Murray exit their game against the Bulls with an apparent leg injury.

items.headline: 2026 NBA Trade Deadline Sees Record-Breaking Activity
items.summary: The 2026 NBA Trade Deadline concluded with an all-time record 73 players traded in 28 separate deals. The Cleveland Cavaliers and Washington Wizards are widely considered major winners, with the Cavs acquiring James Harden and the Wizards landing Anthony Davis and Trae Young.

items.headline: Deni Avdija Remains Sidelined for Blazers
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers forward Deni Avdija missed his fourth consecutive game due to a lower-back strain on Saturday against the Grizzlies. His next opportunity to return is Monday against Philadelphia.

items.headline: Cavs Outlast Kings in Harden's Debut
items.summary: Donovan Mitchell's 35 points and James Harden's 23 led the Cavaliers past the Kings.

items.headline: Nuggets Dominate Bulls, Jokic Sets Record
items.summary: Nikola Jokic's historic triple-double powered the Nuggets to a win, though Jamal Murray left injured.

items.headline: Hornets Sting Hawks on the Road
items.summary: Charlotte secured a road victory over Atlanta.

items.headline: Spurs Defeat Mavericks in High-Scoring Affair
items.summary: San Antonio bested Dallas in a 138-125 contest.

items.headline: Magic Rally to Beat Jazz
items.summary: Orlando overcame a 17-point deficit to defeat Utah.

items.headline: LeBron Leads Lakers Past Warriors
items.summary: Despite missing Luka Doncic, LeBron James guided the Lakers to a win over the Curry-less Warriors.

items.headline: Rockets Topple Short-Handed Thunder
items.summary: Tari Eason's 26 points and Alperen Sengun's triple-double secured a win for Houston.

items.headline: Embiid and Maxey Power Sixers Past Suns
items.summary: Joel Embiid and Tyrese Maxey combined for 62 points in Philadelphia's victory.

items.headline: Donovan Mitchell Leads Cavs Offense
items.statContext: Helped the Cavaliers to a win in Harden's debut.

items.headline: Joel Embiid Dominates for 76ers
items.statContext: Led Philadelphia in their victory over the Suns.

items.headline: Nique Clifford's Impressive Outing
items.statContext: Sacramento rookie led his team in scoring.

items.headline: Tari Eason's Season-High Performance
items.statContext: Led the Rockets to a win over the Thunder.

items.headline: LeBron James Fills the Stat Sheet
items.statContext: Key to the Lakers' victory without Luka Doncic.

items.headline: Key Injury Updates Across the NBA
items.summary: Jamal Murray (DEN) suffered an apparent leg/hip injury. Luka Doncic (LAL) missed Saturday's game with a mild hamstring strain. Stephen Curry (GSW) also missed his third consecutive game due to a knee injury. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (OKC) remains out until after the All-Star break with an abdominal strain. In Phoenix, Devin Booker and Jalen Green were cleared to play on Saturday against the 76ers, but Grayson Allen and Isaiah Livers are out until after the All-Star break.

items.headline: Conference Standings Taking Shape Post-Deadline
items.summary: As of February 7th, the Oklahoma City Thunder (40-12) lead the Western Conference, followed by the San Antonio Spurs (35-16) and Denver Nuggets (33-19). In the Eastern Conference, the Detroit Pistons (38-13) hold the top spot, with the Boston Celtics (34-18) and New York Knicks (33-19) close behind.
